42': Another Rodriguez cross is headed home by Jefferson Lerma
69': Julio Enciso scores to cut Colombia's lead in half
Post-Match Reflections: Colombia have now beaten Paraguay three straight times at Copa America, matching the longest winning run they've ever had against that opponent in the tournament.
Colombia have also won their opening game at four straight Copa America tournaments, their longest such streak since 1983 to 1993.
Nine wins on the bounce for Colombia, and 24 matches since their last defeat.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Colombia's fans popped some smoke bombs and the fire alarm in the press box is now going off.
Paraguay manager Daniel Garnero is upset about something and makes his feelings quite clear, earning himself a yellow card.
Others: Attendance is 67,059 tonight, about 12,000 more than were here for Mexico vs Jamaica on Saturday. That's on a Monday afternoon, at 5PM, in 100-degree heat. Truly a huge number, all credit to the Colombian faithful.
